subject: Personal Finance
title: The Eighth Wonder of the World
description: A fast breakdown of The Eighth Wonder of the World for builders.

hook.text: Invest $1,000 at 7% interest. In 10 years: $2,000. In 30 years: $7,600. In 50 years: $29,500.

buildup.text: Compound interest means you earn returns on your returns. Growth accelerates over time.

discovery.text: Einstein may not have actually called it the eighth wonder of the world, but the math justifies it.

twist.text: Most of the growth happens in the final years. Patience is the real investment strategy.

climax.text: Warren Buffett made 99% of his wealth after age 50. Compounding rewards those who wait.

punchline.text: Time is the multiplier. Start early.

quiz.question: What makes compound interest so powerful?
options: You earn returns on your returns over time
Banks pay higher rates over time
